Title:
The (Un)Reliability of NVD Vulnerable Versions Data: an
Empirical Experiment on Google Chrome Vulnerabilities
Published: Proceedings of the 8th ACM SIGSAC symposium on Information, computer and communications security
Elements_risk_assessment:
we execute annotate command for r f ixed âˆ’ 1 of
file f to obtain the revisions of responsible LoC.
UseOF-SZZ: to locate the vulnerable code responsible for vulnerabilities
Summary:
to validate the reliability of the NVD vulnerable version data. In this experiment, they verify 
    for each version of Chrome that NVD claims vulnerable is actually vulnerable.
Outcome:
The experiment revealed several errors in the vulnerability data of Chrome.
     Also, different conclusions could be obtained due to the data errors.
